Yes, here are some suggestions on how to catch and stop negative self-talk in the moment:

1. Practice mindfulness: Being present and aware of your thoughts, emotions, and physical sensations can help you catch negative self-talk in the moment. When you notice negative self-talk, pause and take a deep breath to regroup and reframe your thoughts in a more positive way. 2. Challenge your negative self-talk: Once you've caught your negative self-talk, challenge it by asking yourself if it's a fact or just an opinion. Often, negative self-talk is based on unfounded assumptions about oneself. Ask yourself if there is any evidence to support the negative thought or if it's just a knee-jerk reaction. 3. Reframe negative self-talk: Replace negative self-talk with positive and empowering affirmations. Reframing negative self-talk can help you shift your mindset and promote self-love and positive self-image. 4. Be kind to yourself: Remember to be kind to yourself and practice self-compassion. Negative self-talk can be a result of internalized criticism and judgments from others, so it's important to treat yourself with kindness and compassion in the moment. 5. Surround yourself with positivity: Surround yourself with people and things that promote positivity and self-love. This can include speaking with friends or family members who uplift and encourage you, listening to music or podcasts that inspire you, or practicing self-care rituals that make you feel good about yourself. In summary, catching and stopping negative self-talk in the moment involves being mindful, challenging negative thoughts, and practicing self-compassion and positivity.
